content.question: Which of the following describes an accurate difference between parliamentary and presidential systems?

choices.label: Parliamentary systems have better rule of law than presidential systems.
Parliamentary systems have fewer institutional obstacles to enact policy.
Parliamentary systems are unitary, whereas presidential systems are federal.
Parliamentary systems have more political parties than presidential systems do.

content.answer: Parliamentary systems have fewer institutional obstacles to enact policy.

topic.text: 2.2: Comparing Parliamentary, Presidential, and Semi-Presidential Systems

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Compare political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
